citation.article-title: Naxibacter varians sp. nov. and Naxibacter haematophilus sp. nov., and emended description of the genus Naxibacter.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Naxibacter varians sp. nov.
Naxibacter varians (va′ri.ans. L. part. adj. varians varying, pertaining to the variable results in biochemical tests).
Cells are non-motile, non-spore-forming rods (approx. 2 μm long and 1 μm wide).
Gram-negative and oxidase-positive, showing an oxidative metabolism.
Good growth occurs on R2A agar, TSA, PYE agar, nutrient agar and MacConkey agar at 25–30 °C.
Growth is detected on TSA at 15–37 °C; no growth at 10 or 45 °C.
Growth is positive in TS broth (TSB) at pH 5.5–10.5 (strain CCUG 48700A is even able to grow at pH 11.5).
Beige, translucent and shiny colonies with entire edges are formed within 24 h, with a diameter of approximately 2 mm.
The quinone system consists of the major compound ubiquinone Q-8 and small amounts of Q-7.

The polyamine pattern contains the predominant compounds putrescine [44.8–69.0 μmol (g dry weight)−1] and 2-hydroxyputrescine [26.3–46.3 μmol (g dry weight)−1] and variable amounts of spermidine [1.4–16.8 μmol (g dry weight)−1] and spermine [1.1–6.0 μmol (g dry weight)−1].
Trace amounts [<1.0 μmol (g dry weight)−1] of 1.3-diaminopropane and cadaverine may also be present.
The major compounds in the polar lipid profile are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
Moderate amounts of an unknown polar lipid and an unknown phospholipid and minor to trace amounts of two unknown aminolipids and an unknown phospholipid are present.
The fatty acid profile is composed largely of C16 : 1ω7c (45.8–50.4 %) and C16 : 0 (31.9–33.3 %).
Carbon-source utilization and hydrolysis of chromogenic substrates (including differentiating characters for all Naxibacter species) are indicated in Table 2.

Sensitive towards polymyxin B (300 U), penicillin G (10 IU), amoxicillin (25 μg), amoxicilin/clovalanat (30 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), trimethoprim (5 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), rifampicin (5 μg) and colistin (25 μg).
The type strain CCUG 35299T (=CCM 7478T) was isolated from the eye of a 90-year-old man in Tromsö, Norway.
Other strains of this species are CCUG 24677A, CCUG 48018, CCUG 49054 and CCUG 48700A.
